fields.description:
When doing planning we use themes to track the different types of work we are doing.  To do this we have co-opted epics to display and filter on this information easily.  This means that we can no longer easily use epics for their original purpose of decomposing large stories.

My suggestion would be to add an additional panel, similar to Version and Epics for adding and sorting into Themes.

The other possible solution for this is to allow placing a story into more than one epic.  This way a story could be part of it's correct Theme and traditional definition of Epic.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using the [JIRA Agile Release Hub|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/checking-the-progress-of-a-version-701268829.html] provides interesting statistics and valuable data on the status of a project. Much of this information can similarly be achieved through the use of JQL filters that determine the status of issues. 

Warnings would be useful to report on and perhaps see inside of Conflunce, or across multiple projects. JQL functionality to get this information would be useful for Project Managers, and Developers who want to see this information.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create some simple to use JQL functions that report the warnings of an issue similar to the Release Hub, but across project.
 
h3. Workaround 
In recent versions of JIRA (6.4+)
It may be possible to use a filter such as: 
{{project = JIRA and status = RESOLVED and issue.property[development].openprs > 0}} for example to see open pull requests that have been resolved to meet this requirement.
fields.summary: Create JQL Functions of Release Hub Behaviour

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you try to log work on an unestimated issue, it is not reflected in the burndown chart.
(!) Note that logging work on an unestimated issue also automatically sets its Remaining Estimate to *0m*. 
After the first work log, the remaining estimate is now set to 0m by JIRA. Now, if we try to log work again on this issue, it gets reflected in the burndown chart even though its Remaining Estimate is already 0m. 
Entry Screenshot: [^ZeroRemainingEstimate.png]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board and sprint. Set board to use Original Time Estimate and use Time Tracking.
# Create an issue with no original or remaining estimates. (leave it unestimated)
# Start sprint.
# Log work on that issue. Notice the remaining estimate is change from Unestimated to 0m. Check Burndown chart to confirm no work log is shown here.
# Log work again. Notice remaining is still 0m, but the Burndown chart is showing the work you just logged. (it still doesn't show the work you logged when the issue was still unestimated)

h3. Suggested Solution
Its weird that we still record work logs for 0m remaining estimates, but we don't record it for Unestimated issues. Suggestion is to include the work log for unestimated issues as well.
fields.summary: Work logged on unestimated issues should be reflected in Burndown Chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A new feature in Agile is that when an issue is a subtask, the name of the parent task will be listed above the subtask in grey.

The issue with this is that issues listed in grey usually lead users to believe that there is something wrong with that issue specifically. 

Additionally, it's not possible to click this.

I can understand how useful it is, if you want to have a subtask in one column and a parent in another, but we may want to adjust how it appears to reduce confusion.

See attachment for how it appears currently.

h3. Suggested Solution
For example, maybe write in bold or another color "subtask of : ABC-123", or say parent task: ABC-123
fields.summary: Greyed parent task above sub-task is misleading

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce using Jira OnDemand:
* Create new status ‘Deployed’ and map to category Done
* Add to workflow and allow transition from all statuses 
* Configure Agile board for project and add Deployed status to the Done column
Note:  we also used Original Estimate for Statistic and Remaining Estimate/Time Spent for Time Tracking
* Start new sprint with two issues each with an Original Estimate of 2 days
* Complete issue 1 and set status to Done
* Complete issue 2 and set status to Deployed
* Complete the Sprint
{color:#14892c}* See Velocity and Sprint Report show 4 days complete at both Project and Component Level{color}
* Update the status on issue 2 from Deployed to Done
* Remove Deployed status from workflow
* Delete Deployed status
{color:#d04437}* Receive internal server error when trying to view Reports at Project Level
* At Component Level, the velocity chart now shows 2 days complete
* At Component Level, the Sprint Report shows Issue 1 as Complete still, but now Issue 2 shows as being removed from sprint{color}
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when viewing reports at Project Level after Removing Custom Status mapped to Done category

fields.description:
In the Create Issue and Edit Issue screens, the "Sprint" menu should list sprint names in the "Suggestions" that are disambiguated by board. 
This already happens in the lower "All sprints" section of the menu, but not in the upper "Suggestions" section.

Without this disambiguation it is easy for users to select an identically-named sprint (e.g. "Sprint 3") from the wrong board.

This would be nice because "Sprint 1", "Sprint 2", etc, are the JIRA default names for sprints, so it is common for the boards of multiple projects to have identically named sprints and thus be completely ambiguous in the Sprint menu.
fields.summary: Sprint name should be disambiguous when creating or editing issues

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use one program and one project and one structure.
Within the project we have multiple teams and thus boards.

Now I ran into contraints that really surporised me so here goes:

1.
Why only admins can start and create sprints as this is typically the role of a scrum master.
Now I have to make all scrum masters admin, meaning they have full control over project and program.In the current setup within Jira the role scrum master is useless.

2.
We use the hiearchy where epics are the toplevel. so epics are realized by features and features are relealized by stories and tasks.
Now the epic is program wide and the featiures are team specific. In other words which teams are needed to realize an epic en which features do they have to complete in order to do so.
The teams would like to see the features in the backlog under the epic link as the features are the big items they need to work on as a team. however Jira can only show EPICs, which basically means that all EPICS will be shown on every team backlog even if epics do not require effort from your team. Due to this limitation we now have changes all Epics to Features and all Features to Epics.
Now the Epic list on the backlog of the teams only shows which the epics that are assigned to that specific team.

3.
Epic link: Why is the epic link nothing more then a label?
If I drag items from the backlog to the epic link the field epic link is filled with the epic however it is not a real link. as when I really want to link stories to epics I have to go the link option and choose realizes and search for the Epic I want to link the story to. Only this way it appears as an child of the EPIC on the structure board.
Why can it not directly make a real link.

4.
Unable to link items on creation.
I now first need to create the issue and then edit the issue again and choose for link in the menu.
Why can I not link it directly without having to reopen the item again.


Kind regards,

Maarten Uppelschoten
fields.summary: Big improvements possible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the administrator in a board in the view with 'groups' and 'users', the only username recognized is the user's first username, in case it has been changed.

This is reproducible in JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a new instance with default permissions, login with a user belonging to these groups only: administators, site-admins (and if it is sysadmin, you can also belong to system-administrators)
#* This is because the fields for configuring of administrators change depending on permissions
# Create a Scrum board
# Create another user with username 'user1'
# Change the user's username to 'user2'
# Go to the board's 'General Configuration' page
# Click 'Administrators' to change the administrators
#* Two fields must appear: 'Groups' and 'Users'. Otherwise, this bug won't happen
# Add 'user2'

h3. Expected Results
The user2 (previous username user1) is added as administrator.

h3. Actual Results
The user is not added. This error appears:
!error_user.png|thumbnail!
It reads:
{panel}
Error
"user2" is not a valid user.
{panel}
 
h3. Notes
The field expected 'user1', though it's actually 'user2' its current username. This is actually stored and kept by JIRA.

Depending on the configuration, when editing this field, this will be visible:
!page.png|thumbnail!

Instead of 'Groups' and 'Users', only one field is visible (that’s why the groups were limited to reproduce the problem). In this case, JIRA will accept the correct usernames.
fields.summary: Changing administrator in board only recognizes old username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-12554].
  {panel}

When exporting data on a machine with *timezone UTC+10* and importing it again on a machine with *timezone UTC+2* all timestamps are off by 8 hours (note: they will show e.g. 4:30 pm on both machines regardless of the timezone). 
This causes issues with JIRA Agile data which is stored as unix timestamps and does not contain a timestamp by definition, those are imported correctly with the right offset.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Set timezone to UTC+10
# Export data
# Stop JIRA
# Set timezone to UTC+2
# Start JIRA
# Import data

*Symptoms*
* Agile charts do not list the correct issues, and the graphs are also incorrect.
* Issue dates such as created, updated are also incorrect.
fields.summary: Incorrect timestamps after re-importing a backup on a machine with a different timezone

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Lexorank Balancing does not complete due to UPDATE AO_60DB71_LEXORANK exceeding acquireLockByRowIds timeout
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to *Lexorank management* in your instance. type g + g + lexorank management.
 # On the *balancing* section, click on *Balance all fields* > wait for sometimes then click on *Refresh*

h4. Expected Result

Lexorank balancing will be completed
h4. Actual Result
 # Lexorank balancing does not complete
 # Problem related to this SQL query performed by *com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.save(...)*:
{code:java}
UPDATE AO_60DB71_LEXORANK SET FIELD_ID = ?, ISSUE_ID = ?, RANK = ?, TYPE = ? WHERE ID = ? AND LOCK_HASH = ? AND LOCK_TIME = ? AND LOCK_TIME >= ?{code}

 # It cannot find any rows with such criteria specified in the WHERE clause {{ID = ? AND LOCK_HASH = ? AND LOCK_TIME = ? AND LOCK_TIME >= ?}}
 ** {{LOCK_TIME = ?}} goes from acquired *Lock* performed by *com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.acquireLockByRowIds(...)*:
{code:java}
UPDATE AO_60DB71_LEXORANK SET LOCK_HASH = ?, LOCK_TIME = ? WHERE ID IN (?, ?) AND (LOCK_HASH IS NULL OR LOCK_TIME < ?){code}

 ** {{LOCK_TIME >= ?}} is being calculated - {{System.currentTimeMillis() - 1500}}.

h4. Additional Information

This would happen in large instance (with more than 1M issues)
h4. Potential Workaround

As per JSWSERVER-15874, if currently using MySQL 5.6.x, *upgrading MySQL to 5.7* might fix the problem
fields.summary: Balancing does not complete due to UPDATE AO_60DB71_LEXORANK exceeding acquireLockByRowIds timeout

fields.description:
We use JIRA onDemand and have purchased the JIRA Agile add on - we love it but we do have one small niggle.

We understand that Scrum performs best when you have physical boards and co-located teams, we aren't in that position. We are globally distributed over multiple timezones and our team members perform their Daily Scrum via Skype or Google Hangouts etc and from experience it seems that many companies are doing the same thing - Scrum is going distributed.

One thing we  have realised is the importance of the team being able at a glance see how their Sprint is going - and if we had a physical board we would be able to easily tell how many "stickies" were either in progress, or to - do. 

Now with the Active Sprint view - it does give that information - but you have to scroll up and down for it, and it's hard to get that "big but quick glance picture".

We have experimented with other tools such as RealTimeBoard - that has a great zoom and  the teams felt that using that tool it bridged the gap between the virtual board and a physical board. However JIRA is better at managing a backlog than RealTimeBoard with all it's filters, searching, tagging, bug raising etc so we have stuck with it.

I would love it if the Active Sprint view was effectively a canvas that you could scroll, pan, and zoom in/out on (though I appreciate that it's a biggy...:) .

Keep it up.

Thanks

Damien
fields.summary: Zoom out function for Active Sprint View.

  {panel}

In an effort to aggregate sprint data, teams are wishing to search and return issue related to all sprints with their standard name (i.e ScrumNinjas*). 

They'd like to be able to search as follows:
Sprint ~"ScrumNinjas"

And have it match all sprints with that as part of the name. Partial matching is currently unsupported for the Sprint field.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,
I have observed a specific problem at several of my clients for which I think I have a functional solution and I would like to ask if it is possible that this feature would be implemented in a future version of JIRA Agile.

Next to (user) stories (describing e.g. new functionality) many of the teams of my clients also add Issue Types such as "Impediments" or "Improvements" to their sprints. If the swimming lane is set to 'Stories" these non-story type of Issues usually end up on the bottom of the board (as they have no subtasks). Quite often, I get the question of it is possible to make sure that certain issues types (for example the Impediments) are always on the top row.

Usually we try then to base the swimming lanes on a JQL query. This works in a sense that we can choose to put the Impediments on the top (for example). However, the user stories and their subtasks end then up in one swimming lane, which can be a bit messy (some teams have many subtasks).

So what I am looking for is being able to combine the best of both worlds: base the swimming lanes on JQL queries AND within those swimming lanes group the user stories with their subtasks (for example by having small swimming lanes withing the JQL-swimming lanes). I think that this would be a great addition for many teams.

Would you please consider this?

Thanks,
Jasper
fields.summary: Improvement on Swimming lane settings for Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We utilize the Atlassian-hosted instance of JIRA.

We use the Flagged field to indicated impediments to tickets.  Our projects have custom contexts for the Flagged field to select the reason for the flag such as: Waiting on customer, Defect rework, Dependent on another US, etc.)

Once the item is unblocked and the Flagged field is unchecked, there is no way for us to run historical reports of:
1. Total number of Flagged incidents
2. Type of Flagged incidents (based on the drop down option selected when flagged)
3. #days item was in Flagged state

Being able to report on these things for a given time period in history would be very valuable to our teams to identify and remediate the most frequent causes of blockage in our flow.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Allow reporting on Flagged field usage in history

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When applying an filter for the agile board to select all closed defects i get 67 results.

looking at the agile board the "done" column shows 67 closed issues.

opening the report button the control chart only shows 26 issues for all time, with all columns selected in the control chart, and no quick filters applied. I was expecting it to show 67 issues (like the query) and their cycle time. What am i doing wrong? or is this a bug? as we are on a older version 6.3.1 is this fixed in newer versions? (if it is a bug)

As we try to baseline some cycle times based upon this its critical the data is correct, which i don't have confidence in when seeing these discrepancies.
fields.summary: Not all issues is shown in the control chart

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Bring up the issue detail view from within a JIRA Agile board.
# Select Attach Screenshot from the "..." menu at the top-right.

The dialog loads fully and it's possible to paste and attach a screenshot to the issue.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is very confusing... and annoying.

All workflows has:
- To Do
- In Progress
- Done

Sometimes instead of "To Do" is old Open and in place of Done is Closed...

So now you have a status categories so maybe it might be a good idea to choose a responding status from those lists.
Or maybe force projects which has Epics to have those statuses (To Do, In Progress, Done).

There is also {code}statusCategory{code} which migh be a good use here.
fields.summary: Use Jira built-in statuses instead of "Epic Status" custom field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I use Sprint Name as a indication for the date of the sprint and a sprint goal.

For example (we have 1 week iteration):
{code}
2015-09 week 1 - Admin Panel Overhaul
{code}
or 
{code}
2015-09 week 2 - General Acceptance Testing
{code}

The sprint goal is very important to keep focus of each team member on the most important outcome of the sprint. Thanks to this one we can focus on delivering the most business valuable stories in the first place. Moreover the Daily Scrum is driven with the information regarding sprint goal only.

Date if for the ordering purposes, and renders very nice descriptions in issue screen (available on board...) and very nice dropdown at charts screen.

Moreover we have developed a tool to build sprint reports in confluence with short summary of the sprint.

In my opinion this meaningful sprint naming convention has far more value than Sprint 1, Sprint 2 etc...

Hence the 30 character limit is... too short.
I have checked in the database and it shouldn't be a problem to extend this one.
fields.summary: Extend the Sprint Name input box maxlength

fields.description:
Steps:

1. Create an agile board with issues that use the default JIRA worklflow
2. Map Resolved and Closed to the same column, e.g. Done
3. Create a Story issue with two subtasks and move them all to In Progress.
4. Drag one of the subtasks to Closed
5. Delete one of the subtasks
6. Now try to drag the one subtask from In Progress to Closed

Expected:

I should be able to drag the single subtask to Closed

Observed:

I could only drag it into Resolved, the top status in that column. I could not choose the second status of Closed.

Environment:
JIRA 6.1.3 standalone
fields.summary: Cannot choose transition if there is just one sub-task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After the latest release of JIRA 7, if we drag a "To Do" status like _Open_ to "Done" Column, JIRA will ignore this association and will resolve recently opened issues. 
For example, after associating the _Open_ status to the "Done" column, users will create an issue  at the current sprint and this issue will disappear from backlog. It will also receive the "unresolved" resolution and the "Done" status.

Some steps to reproduce:
1- Create an agile board.
2 - Configure the board and map statuses to columns. Put an Open status into a Done column.
3 - Create a Sprint with some issues.
4 - Put some un-resolved issues into the column you configured with the open status.
6 - Close the sprint and note that issues will disappear from backlog and assume the status/resolution mentioned below.

JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Done Column ignores the Status associated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After creating a new workflow status and associating it to "Done" column of an Agile Board, JIRA will show its transition on the mentioned column.

Steps to reproduce:
1 - Select a workflow with 3 statuses: Open, In Progress and Resolved.
2 - Add a new status with "To Do" category.
3 - Create back and forth transitions (cardinality 1:1) between the new status and Open status.
4 - Create back and forth transitions (cardinality 1:1) between the new status and In progress status.
5 - Create a Project with any simple issue tracking and associate it with the workflow created before.
6 - Create a Scrum board from an existing project and associate it with the project recently created.
7 - On Board > Configure Board > Columns drag the Unmapped status (the one created previously on step 2) to the "Done" Column.
8 - Create some issues and Start a Sprint. Move the issues from "To Do" to "Done" column. You'll see the transition related to the status recently created on mentioned column.


JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Workflow transitions are shown in Agile Board columns

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If I create an epic and set the security level, the issues are not visible, but any issue in this epic still shows it in the description.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic.
# Set the security to "Reporters and Developers"
# Create an Issue (public).
# Set this issue in this epic.

h3. Expected Results
At this point, as a public user, I shouldn't see this epic anywhere.  Which for the most part is correct, it doesn't show up in the agile board.  The epic issue is not visible etc.

h3. Actual Results
The epic issue is invisible expect when viewing the issue details for the issue created in step 3.  This shows a lozenge for the epic issue and has a click through.  The link goes to the epic's issue and the user is prompted for a login.  I would have expected this to not be visible.
fields.summary: Private epics still visible on public issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Background*
This request would fulfill any query that is running reports against closed sprints. This allows for easy extension of Sprint reporting via dashboards and gadgets on JIRA dashboards as well as Confluence dashboards.

*Use-case*
These types of queries are completely analogous to the specific JQL function {{latestReleasedVersion()}} available against *Fix Version/s*, *Affects Version/s* fields and custom fields extending that type. This obviously would return the most recently completed sprint's issues.

*Example*
I should be able to write a query such as:
{code:SQL}project = ExDevelopment AND Sprint in lastSprint(){code}
fields.summary: In a Filter, I should be able to query for issues closed in the most recently closed sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We constantly run into issues where Team A using sprint name Iteration 1 and Team B uses the same name but on 2 different sprints.  This causes teams to not be able to start/complete sprints since the owners of Team A are not on Team B.  The only way around this we have found is to have team remove the unstarted sprint and recreate it with a new name or have a JIRA Administrator complete/start it for them since we have access to all projects.  We even had an issue today where 1 planned sprint had the same name created as an active sprint on a different board.  When the planned sprint was attempted to be started it could not start.  When they renamed the planned sprint it renamed the active sprint.  They had to delete the planned sprint and start over just to get back this but there was not indication of the issue in the UI.  I was able to see this in the database.  
 
We a way to enforce/correct the use of duplicate sprint names so it does not occur on current/future sprints?
fields.summary: Duplicate Sprint names causes multiple issues with teams

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
This request is originated from the below KB article: [Epic Tag or Label is missing on Sprint board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Epic+Tag+or+Label+is+missing+on+Sprint+board].
Basically, when Epics links created from multiple projects in the Agile board, the Epic tag/label will not appear in the agile board itself unless you add the respective projects in the board filter. This will also have all the epics from the second project displayed in the epics column.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can only those, which are linked with the issues in one particular project.
h3. Workaround 
You can change the board filter to something like the following:
{code}
(project = "PROJECT1" AND status not in (XY) AND (labels != XY OR labels is EMPTY)) OR (project = "PROJECT2" AND issue in linkedIssues(ParentIssue, "LinkType")) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
fields.summary: better filtering for epic link from multiple projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Strikethrough the resolved sub-taks when shown on card in the Backlog view of JIRA Agile is no longer working.

Agiles board was working as expected on JIRA Agile v6.7.7-D20150701T035938.
The issue is occuring on JIRA Agile v6.7.10-D20150729T044856 and JIRA Agile v6.7.11-D20150803T143051.

h3. Environment
-

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add sub-tasks on _Card Layout_
# Close a _Sub-task_ of a parent available on backlog
# Sub-task won't be strikethrough

h3. Expected Results
Resolved sub-tasks are strikethrough on Backlog view
!subtask1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Resolved sub-tasks aren't strikethrough on Backlog view
!agile.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
-
h3.Workaround
-

h3. Original Description

{noformat}

In Version 6.7.11 you fix the bug GHS-12072.

But this is a problem, because now our (and other) custom fields only display HTML text value. Not the HTML. You strip the HTML tags.

In the attachment you see the expected display and the current display.

Please help us.
Thank you!

{noformat}
fields.summary: Agile cards not rendering HTML custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a sample kanban board
# Visit the board and click on Release 

*Expected Results:*
Issues should only be released with a resolution set.

*Actual Results:*
No resolution is set by Agile when releasing a version.

*Workaround:*
# Run a search query that will bring all issues released
# Bulk edit them to set a resolution.
OR
# Create a post-function on your workflow on the Close/Done transition to "Update field" to set a proper resolution
# Run a search query that will bring all issues released and bulk transition then through this status again.

*Versions:*
JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02
JIRA Agile v7.0.0-D20150819T011040
fields.summary: Releasing version through Kanban should ask for issue resolution if none is set.
